intro: Elaphrium mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Elaphrium mexicanum is often found in scrublands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
